I've been working my way through all their offerings and have yet to be disappointed. If you don't know where to start, you can't go wrong with the mac & cheese pizza.

Ian's Pizza is one-of-a-kind.  There really is no substitute for Ian's. I have not tried all of the unique varieties Ian's offers, but people who have seem to really like them. This is the only place I know of that has really good vegan cheese pizza.  The price is good at a few dollars for a slice. The 12" one topping pizza I order there has varied in price. I've been charged between $8.50 (which is a great deal) to $12.50 (which isn't a great deal). On a similar note, they have the 12" pizza made quickly. It usually takes 15-20 minutes at most.   The locations are convenient, I usually eat at the Frances street location. I've also had Ian's deliver, which is quick too. But either way, there wouldn't be any other place I could order from when I wanted Ian's.   If you live in Madison you may have heard of Ian's. If you've heard of it but never tried it, you should.

I have wanted to stop here for a long time and get the mac-n-cheese pizza. It lived up to the hype and was rich and creamy. The ordering process was easy to maneuver and the pizza came out quickly piping hot. Their salads also looked yummy. Loved that they had a free water section by the doors. I would totally come back!

Upon arrival in Madison, I had heard about this pizza. A mac n Cheese pizza?! Pizza plus Mac and Cheese??? How does this work, where are the photos? All night i debated, should I order 1 slice and a regular pie, should I just settle for some food a few feet away. Well I ordered it, I did it and when I pulled up the website I noticed that they now have a Ian's in my home state of Colorado!!! When I text a friend there  about it, I am received with a reply of "are you watching me???" He had just finished a Ian's Mac and cheese pizza! So I questioned him about this pizza, the main question being does it come with any dipping sauces??  So a hour later I am eating my very own and first Mac N Cheese Pizza. I will say I do like it but I'm not sure that it's too much different than just eating Mac and Cheese you know? With that being said I'd order it again, I still want to try some of the other pies with tomato sauce and I'd love for Ian to create some dipping sauces.

Small, unique place that has outstanding pizza!! I'm pretty picky about pizza quality, and this place rocks!!  Old school good pizza, not the crappy pizza chain stuff. The caesar salad was fabulous!  I will return here in the future.

The plain cheese Ian's slice doesn't just bring back warm memories for alumni, for me it brings back the intoxicating thrill of American freedom of speech and worker solidarity.  During a frigid week of protesting with a couple hundred thousand disenfranchised government workers and our wonderful supporters, our spirits were buoyed by the delivery of hot plain cheese pizza from Ian's, ordered and paid for by union brothers and sisters from all over the nation and even from like-minded freedom protesters in Egypt.  We lost that battle, but Wisconsin teachers still strive to properly educate the working masses even in the face of slashed wages and crippling working conditions; Ian's plain cheese pizza to go is still the best snack to munch on while contemplating the beautiful capital dome from the square.
Very creative and tasty pizza! I tried the mac'n'cheese and the bbq potato pizzas. The fresh, Wisconsin cheese was apparent.
Ian's, you are as good as I remenbered you to be!! Its been 8 years, and your mac n cheese slice is still the best slice ive had!!! Keep it up! More years to come!

This place rules!  Awesome food, fun atmosphere, great beer selection and amazing attention to details.  I was so impressed by their unwaivering support of the protestors at the capitol.  These are stand-up businessmen who know how to take care of their people.

where else in the world can you get mac n cheese pizza, or steak and fries. every magical time i was able to go here i loved it. the spinach feta pizza is awesome. pretty much anything you see will be good. and it's not just a gimmick! the pizza is genuinely good and I'll eat every last bite of crust.   i hope that one day i can tour around again and come back for more pizza!

What is not to love about Ian's.  It is my go to place before a Badger game or if I'm doing something on campus.  Mac and Cheese is my go to slice.  But I'm not afraid to try other slices.  Keep up the good work Ian's Pizza!

The Wisco salad was absolutely delicious but way too small for the price! The salads here used to be larger - I don't know why my salad was so small today, though the price stayed the same. I want to give them three stars but I should be full after spending $8.

WOW really......carbs on carbs on fat on carbs....  if you want super junk pizza and a huge slice within 5 minutes of ordering than this is your place. They have tons of options for you like a pizza with avocados, beef, sour cream....a burrito pizza if you will.  Their Mac & cheese pizza is supposed to be super popular but really Madison, really?

The best and most interesting pizza in Madison, a city with a lot of good pizza.  The mac and cheese pizza is justly famous, but there's a long list of great pizzas here you'll find nowhere, or at least hardly anywhere, else; plus a great lineup of weekly special slices ranging from kung pao shrimp to chicken pot pie.  Not every experiment works, but most do.  Standout slices here:  the mac and cheese, of course.  The Philly cheese steak.  Chicken cordon bleu.  Anything with the locally-sourced bacon or pancetta.  I'm told that the steak and fries pizza is second in popularity only to the mac and cheese, but even for me french fries on pizza is a bit much.  $3.50 a slice sounds expensive, but these are big slices; two is plenty for lunch.

Shit late night pizza does not command any leeway for just being available. All it is is convenience. If you are drunk student trying to soak up alcohol, you are not on yelp looking at reviews. Period. To get to review: Shitty greasy cheese and ingredients, so so crust. Do not come here for anything but a "late night feed my drunk wanna get it on with the my date snack". Bon appetit.

Great spot to grab a slice before or after a Badger (insert sport) Game or after sampling the many wares of State Street area bars.  Sometimes the best part of this place is the people watching, as one is guaranteed to see someone drunk do something worth remembering and laughing about later.  As for the pizza, there are plenty of better slices out there, but few for a comparable price. I usually stick with a simple pepperoni and sausage, but the philly steak pizza is pretty good, too. I am not big on the macaroni and cheese pizza, but most people I know love it. I'm a toppings and sauce guy, so it holds no particular power for me. I want to try the brisket and tot pizza, but they have never had it when I was there.  The only reason I don't give the location 5 stars is that the service can be a little uneven. Obviously I am being a bit harsh, because trying to serve a population of drunkards can be challenging at 3am.
What a concept. Any pizza u can imagine. And made for you. This is killer at anytime. The kids love the Mac and cheese pizza. Dude behind be counter is knowledgeable.

mac n cheese pizza is the pizza for you and me.  (channeling my inner Spongebob Square Pants if you catch my drift, if not: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0i6RUN9Akuo)  mac n cheese not your thing? (weirdo). go for the chicken fettucine alfredo. it is one mighty fine medley of two oh so delicious things.   feelin even more adventurous, check out a slice of the bbq brisket tater tot pizza. yeah, that just happened.  Ian's certainly gets pretty creative, but I'm still waiting for this to go down: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OaExAJItfno  one day, one day.

I drove across town on a hot tip from my brother.  He said I had to at least get a slice of mac-n-cheese pizza, but that I should also try others.  On my first trip, I had the mac-n-cheese and the specialty BBQ pulled pork.  Both of these slices were just down right delicious!  The thin crust was crispy and the toppings were abundant.  The second time I went, I had the Chicken cordon blue and a chicken penne pasta... both delightful slices.  When I had to opportunity to go with my brother, he said that he chooses his pizza by picking the most colorful pie.  I found that to be unique and helpful advice.  They have 10oz plastic cups and a water dispenser for free beverage.  They also offer other drinks from the cooler.  I enjoyed seeing the sign that bragged about the biodegradable pizza boxes.  Truly a unique pizza joint.

As soon as I clicked on Ian's, my mouth started to fill up with saliva. It's THAT good. Their mac and cheese slice is uh-maz-ing! But their lasagna slice just might be my favorite. I filled up my frequent buyer card more times than I'd like to admit. Oh, and Ian is just so cute.

Ian's is my favorite pizza place ever.  The environment is always fun (sometimes not so chill but that's to be expected at 2 am on the weekend).  Make sure to try their famous Mac n cheese pizza, as well as their chicken bacon barbecue ranch and the Philly cheesesteak when it rolls around as a special.  They also make awesome ranch, which you should always ask for.  The staff is usually pretty chill, but sometimes a little impatient when dealing with obnoxious drunk people, which is to be expected.  Ian's is good for the family during the day and the best choice you've made with your friends at night.

Was really disappointed in this joint.  After a night of partying, I really wanted some greasy, yet quick snack before heading home.  It took 25 mins for them to serve me 2 slices of pepperoni pizza.  I am typically a patient person, but there were maybe 10 people in the restaurant and because they offered no reason (or apology), I can only assume they were just being lazy.  I'm going to give this place another chance because the pizza was tasty.  But good pizza is easy to come by, it's good service that is a rarity.    As it stands currently, I would recommend Glass Nickel.  The pizza is fantastic and so is the service.

This place is amazing!! I had the Mac n Cheese Pizza and the BBQ Chicken pizza by the the slice. Both were delicious. The friend I was with said it was the best pizza they had ever eaten. I would highly recommend coming here. ImWe got there right before the rush but the workers knew how to handle it. I can't wait to go back.
